article:
{{Infobox Software | name = Operator | screenshot = | caption = Geo microformat,
detected on the Wikipedia page for Great Barr. | developer = Mike Kaply |
latest_release_version = 0.9.5.6 | latest_release_date = July 31, 2010 |
operating_system = Cross-platform | genre = Firefox extension |  website = [http://www.kaply.com/weblog/operator/ Mike's Musings] | }}
'Operator' is an extension for the Mozilla Firefox web browser. It parses and
acts upon a number of microformats, as well as validating them.

Operator lets the user access microformats through a number of methods, all of
which are optional: a toolbar, a toolbar button, a status bar icon, a location
bar icon, or a sidebar.

It has native support for several microformats:

*adr ([http://microformats.org/wiki/adr adr spec]) (postal addresses) *hCard
(contact/ address information) *hCalendar (events) *Geo (geographic coordinates) *rel-tag

and is extensible, in that users can add new actions
for the included microformats, or specify additional microformat recognition.

Operator was written by Mike Kaply of IBM. It forms the basis for
Firefox 3's microformats API,
allowing native support, but has no direct user interface, due to lack of
consensus on the implementation in the GUI.
